metadata.name: Relay Namespaces
metadata.description: This module deploys a Relay Namespace
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Required. Name of the Relay Namespace.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Name of this SKU.
Optional. Authorization Rules for the Relay namespace.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.

Optional. Configure networking options for Relay. This object contains IPs/Subnets to allow or restrict access to private endpoints only. For security reasons, it is recommended to configure this object on the Namespace.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
Optional. The hybrid connections to create in the relay namespace.
Optional. The wcf relays to create in the relay namespace.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting, if deployed. If left empty, it defaults to "<resourceName>-diagnosticSettings".

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Relay Namespace Authorization Rules
metadata.description: This module deploys a Relay Namespace Authorization Rule.
Conditional. The name of the parent Relay Namespace for the Relay Hybrid Connection. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the authorization rule.
Optional. The rights associated with the rule.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the authorization rule.
The resource ID of the authorization rule.
The name of the Resource Group the authorization rule was created in.

metadata.name: Relay Namespace Network Rules Sets
metadata.description: This module deploys a Relay Namespace Network Rule Set.
Conditional. The name of the parent Relay Namespace for the Relay Network Rule Set. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.

Optional. This determines if traffic is allowed over public network. Default is "Enabled". If set to "Disabled", traffic to this namespace will be restricted over Private Endpoints only and network rules will not be applied.

Optional. Default Action for Network Rule Set. Default is "Allow". It will not be set if publicNetworkAccess is "Disabled". Otherwise, it will be set to "Deny" if ipRules or virtualNetworkRules are being used.
Optional. List of IpRules. It will not be set if publicNetworkAccess is "Disabled". Otherwise, when used, defaultAction will be set to "Deny".
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the network rule set.
The resource ID of the network rule set.
The name of the resource group the network rule set was created in.

parameters.authorizationRules: [if(contains(parameters('hybridConnections')[copyIndex()], 'authorizationRules'), createObject('value', parameters('hybridConnections')[copyIndex()].authorizationRules), createObject('value', createArray(createObject('name', 'RootManageSharedAccessKey', 'rights', createArray('Listen', 'Manage', 'Send')), createObject('name', 'defaultListener', 'rights', createArray('Listen')), createObject('name', 'defaultSender', 'rights', createArray('Send')))))]

metadata.name: Relay Namespace Hybrid Connections
metadata.description: This module deploys a Relay Namespace Hybrid Connection.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Conditional. The name of the parent Relay Namespace for the Relay Hybrid Connection. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the hybrid connection.

Required. The user metadata is a placeholder to store user-defined string data for the hybrid connection endpoint. For example, it can be used to store descriptive data, such as a list of teams and their contact information. Also, user-defined configuration settings can be stored.
Optional. A value indicating if this hybrid connection requires client authorization.
Optional. Authorization Rules for the Relay Hybrid Connection.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Hybrid Connection Authorization Rules
metadata.description: This module deploys a Hybrid Connection Authorization Rule.
Required. The name of the authorization rule.
Conditional. The name of the parent Relay Namespace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent Relay Namespace Hybrid Connection. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. The rights associated with the rule.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the authorization rule.
The Resource ID of the authorization rule.
The name of the Resource Group the authorization rule was created in.
The name of the deployed hybrid connection.
The resource ID of the deployed hybrid connection.
The resource group of the deployed hybrid connection.

parameters.authorizationRules: [if(contains(parameters('wcfRelays')[copyIndex()], 'authorizationRules'), createObject('value', parameters('wcfRelays')[copyIndex()].authorizationRules), createObject('value', createArray(createObject('name', 'RootManageSharedAccessKey', 'rights', createArray('Listen', 'Manage', 'Send')), createObject('name', 'defaultListener', 'rights', createArray('Listen')), createObject('name', 'defaultSender', 'rights', createArray('Send')))))]

metadata.name: Relay Namespace WCF Relays
metadata.description: This module deploys a Relay Namespace WCF Relay.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Conditional. The name of the parent Relay Namespace for the WCF Relay. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the WCF Relay.
Required. Type of WCF Relay.
Optional. A value indicating if this relay requires client authorization.
Optional. A value indicating if this relay requires transport security.
Optional. User-defined string data for the WCF Relay.
Optional. Authorization Rules for the WCF Relay.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: WCF Relay Authorization Rules
metadata.description: This module deploys a WCF Relay Authorization Rule.
Required. The name of the authorization rule.
Conditional. The name of the parent Relay Namespace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent Relay Namespace WCF Relay. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. The rights associated with the rule.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the authorization rule.
The Resource ID of the authorization rule.
The name of the Resource Group the authorization rule was created in.
The name of the deployed wcf relay.
The resource ID of the deployed wcf relay.
The resource group of the deployed wcf relay.

metadata.name: Private Endpoints
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. Name of the private endpoint resource to create.
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Required. Resource ID of the resource that needs to be connected to the network.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Required. Subtype(s) of the connection to be created. The allowed values depend on the type serviceResourceId refers to.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group to create if `privateDnsZoneResourceIds` were provided.
Optional. The private DNS zone groups to associate the private endpoint. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. Manual PrivateLink Service Connections.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Groups
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Group.
Conditional. The name of the parent private endpoint. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Array of private DNS zone resource IDs. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
The name of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource ID of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource group the private endpoint DNS zone group was deployed into.
The resource group the private endpoint was deployed into.
The resource ID of the private endpoint.
The name of the private endpoint.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The resource ID of the deployed relay namespace.
The resource group of the deployed relay namespace.
The name of the deployed relay namespace.
The location the resource was deployed into.
